Question: This person was also a unanimous first-team All-Pro selection.
Hints: Shortly after beginning his NFL career, this person started his own charity, the Peyback Foundation.
At the end of the regular season this person was awarded his fourth MVP, breaking the NFL record for most MVPs by a single player.
This person passed for a season-low 125 yards at Cleveland, but the Colts won their 5th straight game, by a final of 10–6.
